node.display_long_description:
Welcome to Facebook Horizon, a social experience where you can explore, play and create. With new worlds in the making, you can join together with people around the world in ever-expanding adventures and amazing experiences. Discover new places with friends, solve interactive puzzles or form teams to compete in action-packed games. You can even design worlds of your own or get to know other members of the community and be inspired by their creations. In Horizon, you're not just a visitor. You're part of what makes it great.

Facebook Horizon is in invite-only beta. To join the beta waitlist, please visit http://www.oculus.com/facebook-horizon

nodes.title: Horizon Release Notes - 4/12/21
nodes.body_text:
What’s New in Horizon - April 12, 2021

UPDATED NEW USER EXPERIENCE
- We are currently rolling out a new first-run experience to onboard users to Horizon. Both new and existing users will see this in the Horizon update.

WORLD HOP
- A faster route to fun! We are experimenting with a new way to help you connect with others in Horizon and Play a featured list of new Mini Games.
In the updated Navigation Menu, select Play, which will take you to a Lobby where you will meet up to 3 others who want to play a round of World Hop with you.
- Or when you are in the World Hop Lobby invite a friend to World Hop with you.
Celebrate in the Rewards Room at the end of the 3 mini games and add new friends via the Final Leaderboard.
While this new feature won’t be visible to everyone in the community, we are working fast in the upcoming weeks to make it available to everyone. We can’t wait to hear your feedback.

NEW GAMES
- Dragon Feeding Frenzy: The dragons are dining out tonight and you’ll have to make sure they have their fill!
- Hungry Birdies: These colorful birdies are ready to be fed, but mama bird needs your help to get the job done.
- Air Dragons: Enter into a mysterious chamber and help navigate your dragon into the winner’s circle.

UPDATED USER MENU
Check out the updated user menu, which ends in the updated Navigation Menu instead of a door to the Plaza.

ACTIONABLE NOTIFICATIONS ON YOUR WRIST
Look out for wrist notifications where you can Invite a Friend to the world you are in, or accept to join a Party.

MANUALLY RESET PANEL POSITIONS IN CREATION TOOLS
Panels getting out of place? You can now hold up on the joystick to reset object properties panels to their default positions.

LISTS (ARRAYS) AND WHILE LOOPS
- We’ve heard your requests and are excited to share that we’ve added initial support for Lists (arrays) of variables and While loops to scripting.
You can create Lists of existing variable types on the Variables tab of the scripting panel.
- You can find the code blocks to use and modify Lists in the Operators tab of the scripting panel. You can get an item from a list, add an item to a list, remove an item, set the value at an index, clear the entire list. You can also get the length of the list or find the index of an item within a list.
- You can find the While block on the Events tab of the scripting panel.
- A few limitations to note:
- Lists can't be used as event parameters.
- Lists can't be populated from property panels.
- “While” cannot be used to evaluate the results of script actions (e.g. checking an object position immediately after a “move to” block).
- “While” has a limit of instructions to avoid expensive/infinite loops, if you run into this limit, the script will stop the current event execution and display a message in the debug panel.

PHASE 1 FIX FOR NEGATIVE SHAPES
Scripts will no longer be able to scale a shape into shapes containing negative scale attributes. Any script which tries to scale an object into negative values will stop at a positive, near-zero value. Objects with no script attached that contain negative scale values and flipped surface normals will be fixed at a later date.

TESTER COLLABORATOR ROLE
You can now add a new type of Collaborator to your world, the “Tester.” This allows you to add other Horizon users as "Testers" to your world. Testers are able to visit the unpublished world, but are not able to edit the world, allowing you to get input and feedback from a smaller group, and improving the quality of your world before publishing.

SHARE WORLD TO FACEBOOK
New flow in the Creator UI where you get a simple prompt right after publishing your world, with a ready-made Facebook post you can choose to share to a group or your timeline.

node.reviewDescription:
Let me first say, it's a great concept with much potential. However, there are some setbacks IMHO.
Entry: it'd be a more pleasant experience for everyone to be on a more " familiar grounded" setting instead of on this cloud-like plaza. To get us even close to the trailer is ideal or maybe like entering the mall type feel. The plaza feels like lobbyish and a bit isolated. It's more likely used as a pit stop. Definitely not a social environment. 
Even add maybe a café like "Big Screen" has (I think.. 🤔.) I would think like the malls. They have open areas to hangout, yet open to everything else. 

As far as the worlds, I'll have to get back and update for a more indepth review. 

Again, I think it's great and Facebook should move forward. I see great and HUGE opportunities, but it appears they may need a bit more social imagination 😂! Ironic, huh?
